name: Co-Com (GMTK '20)
description:
You've been invited to co-commentate on a few episodes for your friend's let's play channel. Nevermind that he has no subscribers, and that he's absolutely terrible at video games; he's your friend, and you owe him a favor. It can't be that bad, can it?

Co-Com is a game where the controls are out of control—more specifically, yours. Guide your friend through a block-pushing puzzle game with simple text commands, but be careful: he won't always do what you say.

Commands:
  • Move [direction] [number of tiles (optional)]
  • Push [direction]
  • Reset
  • Quit

Commands can be chained. For example, go up three, go right and push right is a valid command, and will be executed in order.

This game was made in under 48 hours as part of the GMTK 2020 Gamejam. The theme was 'Out of Control'. Art and music were created from scratch; sound effects and fonts were not created by the dev but were released under open licenses. Powered by Godot.

First jam! First finished game with Godot!
